comment:
He's super sweet! I've never really programmed before this, but the format of the class made it easy to understand the basics of python. He's willing to help you + the class for our overall success. 

There's program labs every two weeks or so, but he preps you beforehand to understand what you're doing. Each unit exam was fairly easy as well.

I had this teacher for IT1114 but he was great. Discussion boards every week but the class was very easy. Your quizzes consist of basic multiple-choice questions and writing code but you have plenty of time to do them and you put them in an auto grader that will give you 0 or 100. Sounds daunting but it's not. Loved this class. All open notes.

Prof. Haggerty was so funny. He told funny stories and made class enjoyable and I always looked forward to coming to class. There was one time when we were writing a program in class and he wanted common names to write into the program. My class and I said a celebrity name and he reacted so hilariously. Overall he always made us laugh especially me

William was probably one of the best professors I've had at KSU, He is extremely lenient and caring for his students and always asks the students what he should do for certain things. He is extremely knowledgeable in his field which makes him a great professor. If he's available for a class Take him.

Great teacher. Grades work pretty decent. If you don't like your grade, he will give you awesome feedback and it's up to you to correct it. If you do decide to, he gives you a 100. Has notes too in D2L for lost moments. He also answers his email ASAP.

Very responsive, clear expectations of grades and late work. Difficult assignments, quizzes, and exams, but you will do just fine if you do them promptly. A couple of extra credit opportunities, overall good experience.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I took this professor for CYBER 3123 during the summer which is similar to IT 3123. Overall, the class was pretty easy, weekly discussions, quizzes each week (open note), and two tests during the semester(midterm and final). Test are lockdown browser but not with a camera. This class shouldn't give you much trouble as is it pretty easy overall.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Overall a pretty easy class! You just have to learn the content from the modules. There are discussion posts, assignments, quizzes, and a few tests, but they are reasonably spaced apart. No lockdown browser!
